comment.text: This translation key is used to display the phrase "Access granted" in various parts of the application, including an info dialog and a table header. The key appears in contexts where access has been successfully authorized or confirmed, providing feedback to users.

usage.context:
lineHeight="16px"
 fontWeight="600"
 noSelect
 truncate
 >
 {t("AccessGranted")}
 </Text>
 
 <Text
 fontSize="13px"
 lineHeight="20px"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Giriş icazəsi verildi' is understandable, a more natural and common translation of 'Access granted' in Azerbaijani would be 'Rəsmi icazə verildi' or 'İcazə verildi'. 'Giriş' implies entry, which isn't the primary meaning of 'Access'.

The Armenian translation 'Մուտքը տրամադրված է' is a literal translation of 'Access granted' but doesn't quite convey the same nuance. 'Access granted' implies permission, while the translation is more like 'The entry has been provided'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and accurate translation would be something like 'Համաձայնություն տրվեց' (Hamadzaynuth t'rvec) which means 'Agreement/Permission granted' or 'Ավանդատուի մուտքը թույլատրվեց' (Avandat'ui mut'q'e tuylat'rvec) meaning 'User access granted'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Accesso permesso' is understandable, a more natural and accurate Italian translation of 'Access granted' would be 'Accesso consentito' or 'Autorizzazione concessa'. 'Permesso' implies permission given by oneself, whereas 'concesso' or 'consentito' indicate permission granted by an authority.

The Lao translation "ເປີດເຣືອນຍ້ອນໄດ້ແລ້ວ" (pəə̀t rʉʉan yɔ̂ɔn dâai lɛ́ɛw) translates to something like 'The house is open because it has been received/granted'. It doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Access granted'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be something like "ອະນຸຍາດເຂົ້າໃຊ້ໄດ້ແລ້ວ" (a-nù-yâat kâo-sái dâai lɛ́ɛw), which means 'Access permitted/granted'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'S-au acordat permisiuni de acces' is overly literal and verbose compared to the concise English 'Access granted'. It doesn't convey the same level of brevity and directness. A more natural Romanian translation would be 'Acces acordat'.

The translation 'අවසර හිමි විය.' while literally meaning 'permission was granted', is not the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'Access granted' in Sinhala. It sounds slightly formal and passive.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'අවසර ලැබුණි' (avasar labeuni) which translates to 'permission received' or 'අවසර ලැබිණි' (avasar labeeni) which is a slightly more formal version. The best option would depend on the overall tone of the application/website.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Prístup bol udelený' is a grammatically correct Slovak sentence, it's a more formal and less idiomatic translation of 'Access granted'. A more natural and commonly used translation would be 'Prístup povolený' or 'Autorizácia povolená'.

The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Приступ одобрен" is a literal translation of 'Access granted' but is not the natural or idiomatic way to express this in Serbian. It sounds awkward. A more appropriate translation would convey the idea of permission or authorization.

While "Chấp thuận quyền truy cập" is a technically correct translation, it's a bit formal for a simple "Access granted." A more natural and common translation would be something like "Đã cấp quyền truy cập" or "Quyền truy cập đã được cấp".
While "访问已授权" is a possible translation, it's a bit literal and formal. "Access granted" usually implies a more casual or affirmative tone. A better translation would convey that feeling.
